testsuite-ext:
&TestSetupWithOut;
A very simple function: No input arguments, and a return statement with a constant expression.
Another very simple function: The input parameter is used as the function's return value, without any transformation.
Another very simple function: The input parameter is copied to a local variable, which is subsequently used as the function's return value.
A simple IF-ELSE-END statement, using a boolean parameter as guard.
A simple IF-END statement, using a boolean parameter as guard.
A simple IF-ELSIF-ELSE-END statement, using boolean parameters as guards.
A simple WITH statement, serving as a sequence of type tests.
A simple WITH statement. Fields of the guarded variable are accessed under the guard. The variable is a parameter, but there is no recursive call involved. That is, a compiler passes this test even if it modifies the signature of a procedure within a branch of a WITH.
Check that a run-time error is reported if none of the guards triggers, and the WITH has no ELSE part.
Another simple function: The boolean input parameter selects between one of the two RETURN statements in the IF statement.
Yet another simple function: Increment input value by one and return the result.
Designator test: access of elements of a character array. The array is passed as a parameter to the function, as is the index.
Simple functions: Compare character parameter with constant character and return different integer values depending on the result.
An error should be signaled if control reaches the end of a function.
Loop variant REPEAT-UNTIL: Calculate string length.
Loop variant WHILE-DO: Calculate string length.
Loop variant LOOP-EXIT-END: Calculate string length.
Loop variant LOOP-EXIT-EXIT-END: Calculate x DIV 10 in a rather silly way for 0 <= x < 20.
Nested REPEAT-UNTIL loops.
Nested loops that triggered a bug in the SSA back-end.
CASE statement using branches with one label, two labels, a range as a label, and an ELSE part. The selector is an integer value.
Check that a run-time error is reported if none of the labels matches, and the CASE has no ELSE part.
Testing shortcut evaluation of operator `&'.
Testing shortcut evaluation of operator `OR'.
Accessing a global variable through a VAR parameter.
Performing INC with default delta on global variable.
Performing DEC with default delta on global variable.
Predefined function CAP for some ASCII characters.
Checks that DIV performs rounding to negative infinity. The divisor is positive.
Checks result of DIV if the divisor is negative.
Checks that MOD performs rounding to negative infinity. The divisor is positive.
Checks result of MOD if the divisor is negative.
Calling LEN on a 2-dimensional array. All legal argument variants are excercised: without dimension, with dimension, and with partially indexed array. Three different kinds of array variables are used: global array variable, open array parameter, and partially open array parameter.
Calling LEN without arguments.
Calling LEN with too many arguments.
Calling LEN with non-array argument.
Calling LEN with an out of range dimension number.
Calling LEN with a non-integer dimension number.
Calling LEN with an integer variable as dimension number.
